message.content: {"id": "120922", "title": "Bug 120922 - \"Dirty Page\" behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement", "description": "When editing the XML in the \"source\" view of the Layout Editor and then attempting to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed indicating that the changes need to be saved. The error message is not clear and does not provide guidance on how to save or discard the changes. The dialog box is titled as \"Error\" and includes quotes. It would be more user-friendly to provide a clearer message and use an appropriate title for the dialog box.", "OB": "The user encounters an error message when attempting to switch from the XML source view to the Layout view without saving changes. The error message states that the \"Source page is dirty\" but does not provide clear instructions on how to save or discard the changes.", "EB": "Instead of the current error message, a more informative and actionable message should be displayed when switching views after making changes. The title of the dialog box should be improved and should not include quotes.", "SR": "Improve the error message when switching views after making changes in the XML Report Designer. Provide clear instructions on how to save or discard changes. Update the title of the dialog box to something more appropriate and remove the quotes."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '120922', 'title': 'Bug 120922"Dirty Page" behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improved', 'description': 'Bug 120922"Dirty Page" behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improved Other pages cannot be used until the source is saved." (including the quotes). And then the user needs figure out how to save or discard their changes. Do you want to save the changes?<Yes <No <CancelYes would save the changesNo would discard the changesCancel would do nothing and remain on the Source pageIn addition, the dialog is titled "Error" (including the quotes). ', 'OB': 'If you edit the XML in the "source" view of the Layout Editor, and then try to switch back to the Layout view, you will get an error message indicating that you need to save your changes.This problem is the user has to figure out what he needs to do to save the changes (or discard them, which is even harder), and the error message is not very good.The error message is "Source page is dirty. ', 'EB': 'A better and more typical approach would be:XML Report Design has been changed. The dialog needs to use a better title (and certainly should not have the quotes). ', 'SR': ''}
